Detailed Description

Compute a few eigenvalues of a sparse matrix.

Wrapper of the arpack library to provide convenient interface. eigtype: "LA" - compute the NEV largest (algebraic) eigenvalues. "SA" - compute the NEV smallest (algebraic) eigenvalues. "LM" - compute the NEV largest (in magnitude) eigenvalues. "SM" - compute the NEV smallest (in magnitude) eigenvalues. "BE" - compute NEV eigenvalues, half from each end of the

the returned eig is in ascending order.

Function Documentation

void eigs ( dmat **  eig,
dmat **  eigv,
const void *  A,
ATYPE  Atype,
const int  neig,
char *  eigtype 
)

compute the eigenvallues.

Full interface, use other want interfaces for simple calling. This is a wrapper to the Arpack library.

Bug:
The Arpack does not work in 32 bit machines.
Parameters:
[out] eig computed eigen values
[out] eigv computed eigen vectors. NULL to disable
[in] A the matrix, dsp or dspcell
[in] Atype type of A, A_SPARSE or A_SPCELL
[in] neig number of eigen values wanted
[in] eigtype type of eigen values. See the file description.

00045     if(!(*eig)){
00046     *eig=dnew(neig,1);
00047     }
00048     
00049     //make sure eig is neig long.
00050     int maxiter=3000;
00051 
00052     //input to dsaupd
00053     int ido=0;
00054     char* bmat="I";
00055     int N;
00056     if(Atype==A_SPARSE){
00057     N=((dsp*)A)->m;//dimension of the eigen problem.
00058     }else if(Atype==A_SPCELL){
00059     N=0;
00060     for(int ix=0; ix<((spcell*)A)->nx; ix++){
00061         N+=((spcell*)A)->p[ix]->m;
00062     }
00063     }else{
00064     error("Invalid Atype");
00065     }
00066 
00067     char* which=eigtype;
00068     int nev=neig;//# of eig val
00069     double tol=0;
00070     double *resid=malloc(sizeof(double)*N);
00071     int ncv=20;//# if columns used.
00072     if(ncv<neig){
00073     if(neig>N) error("Invalid neig\n");
00074     warning("Too many eigen values requested\n");
00075     ncv=neig+20;
00076     if(ncv>N) ncv=N;
00077     }
00078     double *V=malloc(sizeof(double)*N*ncv);
00079     int ldv=N;
00080     int iparam[11]; 
00081     iparam[0]=1;
00082     iparam[2]=maxiter;
00083     iparam[6]=1;
00084     int ipntr[11];//output
00085     double *workd=malloc(sizeof(double)*N*3);
00086     int lworkl=ncv*(ncv+8);
00087     double *workl=malloc(sizeof(double)*lworkl);
00088     int info=0;
00089 
00090     //input to dseupd
00091     int rvec=(eigv!=NULL);//whether want eigen vectors.
00092     char *howmany="A";
00093     int select0[nev];
00094     double *D=(*eig)->p;//output ritz values.(eig val)
00095     //Z,lvz are the save as above V, ldv
00096     double sigma;//not really used.
00097     int ierr=0;
00098     do{
00099     dsaupd_(&ido,bmat,&N,which,&nev,&tol,resid,&ncv,V,&ldv,
00100         iparam,ipntr,workd,workl,&lworkl,&info);
00101     //set to 0 because spmulvec accumulates.
00102     memset(workd+ipntr[1]-1,0,sizeof(double)*N);
00103     if(Atype==A_SPARSE){
00104         spmulvec(workd+ipntr[1]-1,(const dsp*)A,workd+ipntr[0]-1,1);
00105     }else if(Atype==A_SPCELL){
00106         spcellmulvec(workd+ipntr[1]-1,(const spcell*)A,workd+ipntr[0]-1,1);
00107     }else{
00108         error("Invalid A type\n");
00109     }
00110     }while(ido == -1 || ido == 1);
00111     if(info<0){
00112     error("Error with saupd with info is %d\n",info);
00113     }else{
00114     switch (info){
00115     case 1:
00116         warning("Maximum number oof iterations reached.\n"); break;
00117     case 3:
00118         warning("No shifted could be applied during implicit Arnoldi update"
00119             ", please try to increase ncv"); break;
00120     }
00121     
00122     dseupd_(&rvec,howmany,select0,D,V,&ldv,&sigma,
00123         bmat,&N,which,&nev,&tol,resid,&ncv,V,&ldv,
00124         iparam,ipntr,workd,workl,&lworkl,&ierr);
00125     if(ierr!=0){
00126         error("Error with seupd, info is %d\n",ierr);
00127     }else{
00128         int nconv=iparam[4];//# is converged eigs
00129         //info("nconv=%d\n",nconv);
00130         if(nconv<nev){
00131         error("Want %d eigs, only %d converged\n",nev,nconv);
00132         }
00133         if(eigv){
00134         *eigv=dnew(N,neig);
00135         memcpy((*eigv)->p,V,sizeof(double)*N*nev);
00136         }
00137     }
00138     }
00139     free(workl);
00140     free(workd);
00141     free(V);
00142     free(resid);
00143 }

double spmaxeig ( const dsp *  A  ) 

compute the maximum eigenvalue. 

00147                              {
00148     dmat *eig=NULL;
00149     eigs(&eig,NULL,(const void*)A,A_SPARSE,1,"LM");
00150     double eig0=eig->p[0];
00151     dfree(eig);
00152     return eig0;
00153 }

void sptikcr ( dsp *  A,
double  thres 
)

Apply tikhonov regulation with threshold of thres*max(eig(A)).

The maximum eigen value of A is on the same order of magnitude as the maximum number of abs(A). 

00186                                   {
00187     double eig=spmaxeig(A);
00188     dsp *Reg=spnewdiag(A->m,NULL,thres*eig);
00189     spadd(&A,Reg);
00190     spfree(Reg);
00191 }

void spcelltikcr ( spcell *  A,
double  thres 
)

Apply tikhonov regulation with threshold of thres*max(eig(A)).

The maximum eigen value of A is on the same order of magnitude as the maximum number of abs(A). 

00197                                          {
00198     double eig=spcellmaxeig(A);
00199     info("max eigenvalue is %g\n",eig);
00200     for(int ii=0; ii<A->ny; ii++){
00201     //Add to diagonals only.
00202     dsp *iA=A->p[ii+ii*A->nx];
00203     if(iA->m!=iA->n)
00204         error("diagonal block is not diagonal matrix\n");
00205     dsp *Reg=spnewdiag(iA->m,NULL,thres*eig);
00206     spadd(&iA,Reg);
00207     spfree(Reg);
00208     }
00209 }
